condition.description:
An arrhythmia is a problem with the speed or rhythm of the heartbeat. Atrial fibrillation (AF) is the most common type of arrhythmia. The cause is a disorder in the heart's electrical system.

Often, people who have AF may not even feel symptoms. But you may feel

  • Palpitations -- an abnormal rapid heartbeat
  • Shortness of breath
  • Weakness or difficulty exercising
  • Chest pain
  • Dizziness or fainting
  • Fatigue
  • Confusion

AF can lead to an increased risk of stroke. In many patients, it can also cause chest pain, heart attack, or heart failure.

Doctors diagnose AF using family and medical history, a physical exam, and a test called an electrocardiogram (EKG), which looks at the electrical waves your heart makes. Treatments include medicines and procedures to restore normal rhythm.

NIH: National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute
condition.name: Atrial fibrillation

carousel_items: Check your blood pressure 1 week after starting this medicine, and tell your doctor if it hasn't improved.
Interacts with grapefruit and the cholesterol medicine Simvastatin.
Can cause constipation and headache.
Don't drink too much alcohol while taking this medicine.
Your doctor might do routine blood tests to check your liver function.

basics.benefits_moa: Verapamil is a calcium channel blocker. It lowers blood pressure by slowing your heart rate and relaxing your blood vessels. Your heart gets more oxygen and doesn't have to work as hard to pump, which can relieve chest pain.
basics.bottom_line: Verapamil works well to lower blood pressure and prevent chest pain, but you have to be okay with avoiding alcohol. You can't miss doses, and you might get persistent swelling.
downsides: Calcium channel blockers can cause swelling in your limbs. If this happens for you, it probably won't get better over time, so talk to your doctor about alternatives if it bothers you.
Women are more likely to have side effects (especially swelling) from Verapamil than men.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Verapamil suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.
Not a good medication for you if you drink alcohol.

downsides_processed.orig: Calcium channel blockers can cause swelling in your limbs. If this happens for you, it probably won't get better over time, so talk to your doctor about alternatives if it bothers you.
Women are more likely to have side effects (especially swelling) from Verapamil than men.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Verapamil suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.
Not a good medication for you if you drink alcohol.

upsides: A first-choice blood pressure treatment for many people.
Calcium channel blockers work especially well for African Americans to lower blood pressure.
You can take it alone or with other medicines to help lower blood pressure.
Lowers the risk of heart attack and stroke.
Prevents heart-related chest pain (angina) if you take it regularly.
Treats certain abnormal heart rhythms.

You can take it alone or with other medicines to help lower blood pressure.
Lowers the risk of heart attack and stroke.

Treats certain abnormal heart rhythms.

carousel_items_processed.orig: Check your blood pressure 1 week after starting this medicine, and tell your doctor if it hasn't improved.
Interacts with grapefruit and the cholesterol medicine Simvastatin.
Can cause constipation and headache.
Don't drink too much alcohol while taking this medicine.

risks_warnings.title: Heart failure
risks_warnings.description: Reports of heart failure or pulmonary edema (increased fluid in the lungs) have been reported. If your doctor feels that Verapamil will work for you, they will work with you to control the issues with your heart before starting Verapamil.

description_processed.orig: Reports of heart failure or pulmonary edema (increased fluid in the lungs) have been reported. If your doctor feels that Verapamil will work for you, they will work with you to control the issues with your heart before starting Verapamil.

risks_warnings.title: Low blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: You may experience sudden drops in blood pressure while on Verapamil, which may cause dizziness. Be careful when getting up from either a seated or lying down position to prevent falls.

description_processed.orig: You may experience sudden drops in blood pressure while on Verapamil, which may cause dizziness. Be careful when getting up from either a seated or lying down position to prevent falls.

risks_warnings.title: Elevated liver enzymes
risks_warnings.description: Your doctor may check your liver regularly, as there have been reports of liver damage which can only be seen through blood tests. If you do have a history of liver disease, let your doctor know.

description_processed.orig: Your doctor may check your liver regularly, as there have been reports of liver damage which can only be seen through blood tests. If you do have a history of liver disease, let your doctor know.

risks_warnings.title: Heart rhythm problems
risks_warnings.description: Your doctor may monitor your heart to see if changes to its electrical system may occur, especially if you have had liver or kidney disease in the past.

description_processed.orig: Your doctor may monitor your heart to see if changes to its electrical system may occur, especially if you have had liver or kidney disease in the past.

carousel_items: Take it at the same time every day.
Drink plenty of water while taking this medicine.
Requires routine blood tests to make sure you have the right amount of Digoxin in your body.
Tell your doctor about other medicines you're taking to avoid drug interactions.

basics.benefits_moa: Digoxin helps your heart work more efficiently. It makes your heart pump slower and stronger, which helps it get more blood and oxygen out to your body and organs.
basics.bottom_line: Digoxin is a good backup for treating heart failure symptoms, but it doesn't, by itself, lower your risk of death.
downsides: For heart failure, relieves symptoms, but does not lower the risk of death. That's why it's usually used together with other heart failure medicines that do lower the risk of death.
Requires blood tests, especially during the first few weeks of treatment.

downsides_processed.orig: For heart failure, relieves symptoms, but does not lower the risk of death. That's why it's usually used together with other heart failure medicines that do lower the risk of death.
Requires blood tests, especially during the first few weeks of treatment.

upsides: Used for some abnormal heart rhythms, and for heart failure that can't be controlled by other medications.
Relieves shortness of breath, and makes it easier to be active without having symptoms.
In studies, Digoxin lowered the risk of having to be admitted to the hospital for worsening heart failure.

upsides_processed.orig: Used for some abnormal heart rhythms, and for heart failure that can't be controlled by other medications.
Relieves shortness of breath, and makes it easier to be active without having symptoms.
In studies, Digoxin lowered the risk of having to be admitted to the hospital for worsening heart failure.

userStories.tip: The recommended appropriate dosage is one tablet (125 mcg.) by oral route once daily.

drugs.name: Digoxin

carousel_items_processed.orig: Take it at the same time every day.
Drink plenty of water while taking this medicine.
Requires routine blood tests to make sure you have the right amount of Digoxin in your body.
Tell your doctor about other medicines you're taking to avoid drug interactions.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems
risks_warnings.description: Digoxin can cause changes to your heartbeat (ventricular fibrillation) if you have a rare condition called Wolff-Parkinson-White syndrome. Talk to your doctor if you have this condition.

description_processed.orig: Digoxin can cause changes to your heartbeat (ventricular fibrillation) if you have a rare condition called Wolff-Parkinson-White syndrome. Talk to your doctor if you have this condition.

risks_warnings.title: Increased digoxin levels in the blood
risks_warnings.description: Digoxin can be harmful if too much is taken. Your prescriber will monitor your blood to make sure you have the correct amount in your body. If you or your caregivers/family notice nausea, vomiting, changes in vision or inability to eat, let your doctor know as soon as possible.
risk_factors: Low body weight, advanced age, impaired renal function, electrolyte imbalances

description_processed.orig: Digoxin can be harmful if too much is taken. Your prescriber will monitor your blood to make sure you have the correct amount in your body. If you or your caregivers/family notice nausea, vomiting, changes in vision or inability to eat, let your doctor know as soon as possible.

risks_warnings.title: Changes in thyroid medications
risks_warnings.description: Digoxin can have increased or decreased effects if you have thyroid problems. Tell your doctor if you have problems with your thyroid as they may have to adjust your medications.

description_processed.orig: Digoxin can have increased or decreased effects if you have thyroid problems. Tell your doctor if you have problems with your thyroid as they may have to adjust your medications.

risks_warnings.title: Allergic reaction
risks_warnings.description: People on the 0.125 mg strength of Digoxin can develop an allergic reaction, especially if you have an allergy to aspirin. Tell your prescriber if you are allergic to aspirin.

description_processed.orig: People on the 0.125 mg strength of Digoxin can develop an allergic reaction, especially if you have an allergy to aspirin. Tell your prescriber if you are allergic to aspirin.

risks_warnings.title: Heart rhythm problems
risks_warnings.description: Taking Digoxin before fixing your heart rhythm by doing an electrocardioversion may increase your risk for changes in your heartbeat called ventricular fibrillation. Tell your doctor if you are taking Digoxin if they are considering this procedure.

description_processed.orig: Taking Digoxin before fixing your heart rhythm by doing an electrocardioversion may increase your risk for changes in your heartbeat called ventricular fibrillation. Tell your doctor if you are taking Digoxin if they are considering this procedure.

points.name: Abdominal pain
points.hlt: gastrointestinal and abdominal pains (excl oral and throat)

carousel_items: Take twice a day, with or without food, at the same time each day.
Needs to be stopped prior to dental procedures or surgery.
You can bruise easier and if you have a cut, it can take longer for bleeding to stop.
Do not take with other drugs that affect your blood, like aspirin, ibuprofen, warfarin, or SSRIs.
Call a doctor immediately if you have dizziness, weakness, or a really bad headache.

basics.benefits_moa: Eliquis is a factor Xa inhibitor anticoagulant and prevents the formation of blood clots in your veins.
basics.bottom_line: Eliquis is an easy to use and effective way to prevent blood clots from forming in your veins.
downsides: You can bruise easier and if you cut yourself, it'll take longer to stop the bleeding. Always look for signs of internal bleeding, such as dark urine or blood in your stool.
Can't be used if you have artificial heart valves.
Never stop taking Eliquis without talking to your doctor first.
Eliquis isn't available as a generic, so it can be pricey.

downsides_processed.orig: You can bruise easier and if you cut yourself, it'll take longer to stop the bleeding. Always look for signs of internal bleeding, such as dark urine or blood in your stool.
Can't be used if you have artificial heart valves.
Never stop taking Eliquis without talking to your doctor first.
Eliquis isn't available as a generic, so it can be pricey.

upsides: Eliquis is very effective in reducing the threat of stroke in people with Afib or other clotting disorders.
Eliquis doesn't require regular blood testing and doesn't have dietary restrictions.
If you've had clots in your legs or lungs before, Eliquis can lower the risk of these forming again.

upsides_processed.orig: Eliquis is very effective in reducing the threat of stroke in people with Afib or other clotting disorders.
Eliquis doesn't require regular blood testing and doesn't have dietary restrictions.
If you've had clots in your legs or lungs before, Eliquis can lower the risk of these forming again.

you may get swelling in your legs

carousel_items_processed.orig: Take twice a day, with or without food, at the same time each day.
Needs to be stopped prior to dental procedures or surgery.
You can bruise easier and if you have a cut, it can take longer for bleeding to stop.
Do not take with other drugs that affect your blood, like aspirin, ibuprofen, warfarin, or SSRIs.
Call a doctor immediately if you have dizziness, weakness, or a really bad headache.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risk of stroke or blood clots
risks_warnings.description: Don't stop taking Eliquis before your doctor tells you to. You could be at a higher risk for stroke or heart attack, especially if you have certain heart rate problems, like atrial fibrillation. Talk to your doctor if you're interested in stopping this medicine or switching to a different one.

description_processed.orig: Don't stop taking Eliquis before your doctor tells you to. You could be at a higher risk for stroke or heart attack, especially if you have certain heart rate problems, like atrial fibrillation. Talk to your doctor if you're interested in stopping this medicine or switching to a different one.

risks_warnings.title: Blood clot in the spine
risks_warnings.description: You're more likely to have a blood clot in the spine if you're taking Eliquis and are getting either a spinal tap or an epidural. Call your doctor immediately if you notice pain or a tingling or burning sensation, numbness, weakness, or inability to urinate.
risk_factors: Getting anesthesia in the spine (epidural anesthesia)

description_processed.orig: You're more likely to have a blood clot in the spine if you're taking Eliquis and are getting either a spinal tap or an epidural. Call your doctor immediately if you notice pain or a tingling or burning sensation, numbness, weakness, or inability to urinate.

risks_warnings.title: Unusual bleeding
risks_warnings.description: There are certain medicines that can significantly change the amount of Eliquis in your body, putting you at risk for bleeding or making the drug less effective. Let your doctor know about other prescription and non-prescription medicines you're taking, especially other medicines that affect bleeding risk like aspirin and NSAIDs.

description_processed.orig: There are certain medicines that can significantly change the amount of Eliquis in your body, putting you at risk for bleeding or making the drug less effective. Let your doctor know about other prescription and non-prescription medicines you're taking, especially other medicines that affect bleeding risk like aspirin and NSAIDs.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risk of stroke or bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Talk to your doctor if you have or you're planning to have an artificial heart valve placed, since taking Eliquis will put you at higher risk of either stroke or bleeding. Your doctor will have to put you on a different medicine.

description_processed.orig: Talk to your doctor if you have or you're planning to have an artificial heart valve placed, since taking Eliquis will put you at higher risk of either stroke or bleeding. Your doctor will have to put you on a different medicine.

risks_warnings.title: Increased side effects
risks_warnings.description: Eliquis is processed by the kidney and liver. If you have kidney or liver problems, talk to your doctor about possibly switching to a different medicine to prevent increased risk for side effects.

description_processed.orig: Eliquis is processed by the kidney and liver. If you have kidney or liver problems, talk to your doctor about possibly switching to a different medicine to prevent increased risk for side effects.

carousel_items: Pradaxa is an anticoagulant, so it's important not to miss a dose. Don't stop taking this medication without talking to your doctor first.
When taking Pradaxa, you can bleed more easily, so use a soft toothbrush and an electric razor to avoid cutting yourself.
Take this exactly as your doctor or pharmacist tells you to.
Take with a full glass of water. Swallow the capsule whole. Don't chew, break, or open the capsule.

clock.tip: Works faster if taken without food.

basics.benefits_moa: Pradaxa is an anticoagulant that stops the formation of blood clots.
basics.bottom_line: Pradaxa is a good medication for preventing blood clots. It doesn't require regular blood tests or changing doses often. It can be expensive and there's no way to reverse the medication's effects.
downsides: Not available as generic.
There are no antidotes to stop bleeding caused by taking too much Pradaxa.
Can't take during pregnancy.

downsides_processed.orig: Not available as generic.
There are no antidotes to stop bleeding caused by taking too much Pradaxa.
Can't take during pregnancy.

upsides: Clinical studies have shown that the risk of stroke and blood clots is lower than with warfarin, another popular "blood thinner" (anticoagulant).
Doesn't require regular blood tests or frequent dose changes.
In studies comparing Pradaxa to other "blood thinners", it worked just as well in preventing strokes and was better in lowering the risk of bleeding.

upsides_processed.orig: Clinical studies have shown that the risk of stroke and blood clots is lower than with warfarin, another popular "blood thinner" (anticoagulant).
Doesn't require regular blood tests or frequent dose changes.
In studies comparing Pradaxa to other "blood thinners", it worked just as well in preventing strokes and was better in lowering the risk of bleeding.

userStories.tip: Must take with food and liquid

carousel_items_processed.orig: Pradaxa is an anticoagulant, so it's important not to miss a dose. Don't stop taking this medication without talking to your doctor first.
When taking Pradaxa, you can bleed more easily, so use a soft toothbrush and an electric razor to avoid cutting yourself.
Take this exactly as your doctor or pharmacist tells you to.
Take with a full glass of water. Swallow the capsule whole. Don't chew, break, or open the capsule.

risks_warnings.title: Blood clots
risks_warnings.description: Don't stop taking Pradaxa until your doctor tells you to, since stopping too early can put you at greater risk for getting blood clots or stroke, especially if you're not being switched to another blood thinner to continue treatment. Talk to your doctor first if you want to stop this medication.

description_processed.orig: Don't stop taking Pradaxa until your doctor tells you to, since stopping too early can put you at greater risk for getting blood clots or stroke, especially if you're not being switched to another blood thinner to continue treatment. Talk to your doctor first if you want to stop this medication.

risks_warnings.title: Blood clot in the spine
risks_warnings.description: If you've had a spinal tap or an anesthetic injected into your spine (epidural anesthetic) and you're taking Pradaxa, call your doctor immediately if you suddenly feel back pain, numbness or tingling in the legs, muscle weakness, or incontinence. This can be a sign that there is a bruise or collection of blood around the spine and it could cause paralysis.
risk_factors: Taking NSAIDs, aspirin, or other blood-thinning medicines

description_processed.orig: If you've had a spinal tap or an anesthetic injected into your spine (epidural anesthetic) and you're taking Pradaxa, call your doctor immediately if you suddenly feel back pain, numbness or tingling in the legs, muscle weakness, or incontinence. This can be a sign that there is a bruise or collection of blood around the spine and it could cause paralysis.

risks_warnings.title: Unusual bleeding
risks_warnings.description: You can experience easier bleeding or bruising while on Pradaxa. Call your doctor immediately if you notice any of these symptoms: bruising when you don't know the cause, pink or brown urine, bright red or dark tarry stool, coughing up blood, or throwing up blood that looks like coffee grounds.
risk_factors: Taking with NSAIDs, aspirin, or other blood-thinning medicines

description_processed.orig: You can experience easier bleeding or bruising while on Pradaxa. Call your doctor immediately if you notice any of these symptoms: bruising when you don't know the cause, pink or brown urine, bright red or dark tarry stool, coughing up blood, or throwing up blood that looks like coffee grounds.

risks_warnings.title: Stomach or intestinal problems
risks_warnings.description: You can be more likely to have stomach or intestinal problems while on Pradaxa. Call your doctor if you have upset stomach; nausea; burning, pain or discomfort in the middle of your chest or in your stomach and abdomen.

description_processed.orig: You can be more likely to have stomach or intestinal problems while on Pradaxa. Call your doctor if you have upset stomach; nausea; burning, pain or discomfort in the middle of your chest or in your stomach and abdomen.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risk of stroke or bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Talk to your doctor if you have or you're planning to have an artificial heart valve placed, since taking Pradaxa will put you at higher risk of either stroke or bleeding. Your doctor will have to put you on a different medication.

description_processed.orig: Talk to your doctor if you have or you're planning to have an artificial heart valve placed, since taking Pradaxa will put you at higher risk of either stroke or bleeding. Your doctor will have to put you on a different medication.

carousel_items: Xarelto is an anticoagulant, so it's important not to miss a dose. Don't stop taking this medication without talking to your doctor first.
When taking Xarelto, you can bleed more easily, so use a soft toothbrush and an electric razor to avoid cutting yourself.
Take Xarelto with food and a full glass of water.
You can crush the tablets and mix with applesauce.

clock.tip: Take with food to work faster.

basics.benefits_moa: Xarelto is an anticoagulant that stops the formation of blood clots.
basics.bottom_line: Xarelto is a good medication for preventing blood clots. It doesn't require regular blood tests or changing doses often. It can be expensive and there's no way to reverse the medication's effects.
downsides: Xarelto can increase your risk of bleeding. Call your doctor right away if there is blood in your phlegm, urine, or stool (look for black, tarry stools).
Xarelto isn't available as a generic medication.
There are no antidotes to stop bleeding caused by taking too much Xarelto.
Can't take during pregnancy.

downsides_processed.orig: Xarelto can increase your risk of bleeding. Call your doctor right away if there is blood in your phlegm, urine, or stool (look for black, tarry stools).
Xarelto isn't available as a generic medication.
There are no antidotes to stop bleeding caused by taking too much Xarelto.
Can't take during pregnancy.

upsides: Studies have shown that Xarelto works just as well as other blood thinners (anticoagulants) in preventing strokes and reducing bleeding.
Xarelto doesn't require regular blood testing or frequent dose adjustments.
Xarelto doesn't have as many food interactions as compared to other anticoagulants like warfarin (Coumadin).

upsides_processed.orig: Studies have shown that Xarelto works just as well as other blood thinners (anticoagulants) in preventing strokes and reducing bleeding.
Xarelto doesn't require regular blood testing or frequent dose adjustments.
Xarelto doesn't have as many food interactions as compared to other anticoagulants like warfarin (Coumadin).

userStories.tip: Works well for me, saves many trips to control Coumadin which I used before.  I think it is safe, my doctors say it is.  Is not cheap but Medicare covers it with $33 co pay (per month).
Took about a week for the skin itching to subside. Skin dryness continued for another month or so but easily relieved with lotion. No other problems to report. Way better experience than warfarin!

Take with food. My skin started itching like crazy all over for the first week. That eventually subsided but skin is very dry all the time now. Have to coat entire body with shae butter day and night to treat the dry skin.
Taking it with food may make it easier on your stomach.  Tendency to bruise lessens with time.

risks_warnings.title: Blood clots and stroke
risks_warnings.description: Don't stop taking Xarelto until your doctor tells you to, since stopping too early can put you at greater risk for getting blood clots or stroke, especially if you're not being switched to another blood thinner to continue treatment. Talk to your doctor first if you want to stop this medication. Also, Xarelto isn't right for you if you have an artificial heart valve because it can increase your risk of blood clots or stroke.

description_processed.orig: Don't stop taking Xarelto until your doctor tells you to, since stopping too early can put you at greater risk for getting blood clots or stroke, especially if you're not being switched to another blood thinner to continue treatment. risks_warnings.title: Blood clot in the spine
risks_warnings.description: You're at greater risk for a blood clot in the spine if you're taking Xarelto and you get either a spinal tap or an epidural. A blod clot in your spine can cause paralysis. Call your doctor immediately if you notice pain or a tingling or burning sensation, numbness, weakness, or incontinence.
risk_factors: Getting anesthesia in the spine (epidural anesthesia)

description_processed.orig: You're at greater risk for a blood clot in the spine if you're taking Xarelto and you get either a spinal tap or an epidural. A blod clot in your spine can cause paralysis. Call your doctor immediately if you notice pain or a tingling or burning sensation, numbness, weakness, or incontinence.

risks_warnings.title: Unusual bleeding
risks_warnings.description: As with all blood thinners, it will take a little longer for your blood to clot if you're bleeding and on Xarelto. Call your doctor if you notice bleeding that won't stop, a bruise that won't go away or gets worse, pink or brown urine, bright red or dark tarry stool, nose bleeds, or coughing up blood.
risk_factors: Taking NSAIDs, aspirin, or other blood-thinning medicines

description_processed.orig: As with all blood thinners, it will take a little longer for your blood to clot if you're bleeding and on Xarelto. Call your doctor if you notice bleeding that won't stop, a bruise that won't go away or gets worse, pink or brown urine, bright red or dark tarry stool, nose bleeds, or coughing up blood.

carousel_items: Your doctor may have you start taking Amiodarone in a hospital or clinic so you can be watched closely for side effects.
It can take 1 or 2 weeks before you start to see any effects.
There are many serious side effects that can only be found by getting blood tests done. It's important to follow all of your doctor's instructions when taking Amiodarone.
Can make your skin more sensitive to sun. Use proper protection, such as sunscreen, and avoid sun lamps.
Can cause nausea, so you can take it with food to help.
Drinking grapefruit juice with Amiodarone can affect your heart rate, so avoid all forms of grapefruits.

basics.benefits_moa: Amiodarone is an anti-arrhythmic medicine. It treats heart rate problems by blocking rogue electrical signals in your heart.
basics.bottom_line: Amiodarone is an option to treat heart rate problems when other medicines don't work, but it can take a few weeks to work and there's a lot of serious side effects.
downsides: Not a good choice if you have eye, liver, or lung problems.
You'll need regular monitoring for side effects, such as routine blood tests, heart tests, and eye exams.
Amiodarone can stay in your body for weeks or months after you've stopped taking it. Make sure you tell your doctor or dentist that you've taken Amiodarone if they don't already know.
There are many possible drug interactions, so talk to your doctor or pharmacist before making any changes or starting a new medicine.

downsides_processed.orig: Not a good choice if you have eye, liver, or lung problems.
You'll need regular monitoring for side effects, such as routine blood tests, heart tests, and eye exams.
Amiodarone can stay in your body for weeks or months after you've stopped taking it. Make sure you tell your doctor or dentist that you've taken Amiodarone if they don't already know.
There are many possible drug interactions, so talk to your doctor or pharmacist before making any changes or starting a new medicine.

upsides: An option for treating life-threatening heart rate problems when other medicines or procedures haven't worked.
Amiodarone has been shown to lower the number of heart rate problems you can experience after certain types of heart surgeries.
Available as a generic version, so it should be affordable.

upsides_processed.orig: An option for treating life-threatening heart rate problems when other medicines or procedures haven't worked.
Amiodarone has been shown to lower the number of heart rate problems you can experience after certain types of heart surgeries.
Available as a generic version, so it should be affordable.

userStories.tip: Take the loading dose (several weeks) alone so if you vomit 20 minutes later, you only lose one drug, not your entire regimen. 800mg is hard for me to keep down. Maintenance dose (after 2 weeks) is a piece of cake.

drugs.name: Amiodarone

carousel_items_processed.orig: Your doctor may have you start taking Amiodarone in a hospital or clinic so you can be watched closely for side effects.
It can take 1 or 2 weeks before you start to see any effects.
There are many serious side effects that can only be found by getting blood tests done. It's important to follow all of your doctor's instructions when taking Amiodarone.
Can make your skin more sensitive to sun. Use proper protection, such as sunscreen, and avoid sun lamps.
Can cause nausea, so you can take it with food to help.
Drinking grapefruit juice with Amiodarone can affect your heart rate, so avoid all forms of grapefruits.

risks_warnings.title: Life-threatening heart rate problems
risks_warnings.description: Amiodarone should only be used in people with life-threatening heart rate problems. There are many potentially fatal side effects and it can make the heart rate problem worse or harder to handle. Other similar medicines should be tried first before Amiodarone. People can start taking Amiodarone in a hospital to watch for side effects.

description_processed.orig: Amiodarone should only be used in people with life-threatening heart rate problems. There are many potentially fatal side effects and it can make the heart rate problem worse or harder to handle. Other similar medicines should be tried first before Amiodarone. People can start taking Amiodarone in a hospital to watch for side effects.

risks_warnings.title: Lung damage
risks_warnings.description: Amiodarone can cause serious lung problems, sometimes without any symptoms. Call your doctor immediately if you have any breathing problems, like shortness of breath, trouble breathing, or a cough. Baseline and follow-up lab tests, including chest x-rays every 3 to 6 months, are needed before starting Amiodarone.

description_processed.orig: Amiodarone can cause serious lung problems, sometimes without any symptoms. Call your doctor immediately if you have any breathing problems, like shortness of breath, trouble breathing, or a cough. Baseline and follow-up lab tests, including chest x-rays every 3 to 6 months, are needed before starting Amiodarone.

risks_warnings.title: Liver damage
risks_warnings.description: Amiodarone is broken down by the liver. It can cause mild liver problems, but in some cases, it can cause severe problems. Call your doctor immediately if you have dark urine or light-colored stool, yellow skin or eyes, stomach pain, or feel tired or not hungry. If you have liver problems, you may need a different dose to prevent increased risk for side effects. Baseline and follow-up lab tests are needed before starting Amiodarone.

description_processed.orig: Amiodarone is broken down by the liver. It can cause mild liver problems, but in some cases, it can cause severe problems. Call your doctor immediately if you have dark urine or light-colored stool, yellow skin or eyes, stomach pain, or feel tired or not hungry. If you have liver problems, you may need a different dose to prevent increased risk for side effects. Baseline and follow-up lab tests are needed before starting Amiodarone.

risks_warnings.title: Vision problems
risks_warnings.description: Vision problems, such as blurred vision, decreased peripheral vision, or visual halos, can occur. Talk to your doctor if you experience any vision impairment and make sure you have regular eye exams every 6 months.

description_processed.orig: Vision problems, such as blurred vision, decreased peripheral vision, or visual halos, can occur. Talk to your doctor if you experience any vision impairment and make sure you have regular eye exams every 6 months.

risks_warnings.title: Thyroid problems
risks_warnings.description: Amiodarone can cause low or high levels of thyroid hormone. Talk to your doctor if you have a history of thyroid problems or are taking thyroid medicine. Baseline and follow-up lab tests are needed every 6 months before starting Amiodarone.

description_processed.orig: Amiodarone can cause low or high levels of thyroid hormone. Talk to your doctor if you have a history of thyroid problems or are taking thyroid medicine. Baseline and follow-up lab tests are needed every 6 months before starting Amiodarone.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Amiodarone can cause birth defects. Don't use Amiodarone while pregnant. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

description_processed.orig: Amiodarone can cause birth defects. Don't use Amiodarone while pregnant. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

carousel_items: Can cause dizziness in the first few days.
Get your blood pressure, potassium, and kidney function checked 1 week after starting the medicine, then routinely after.
Tell your doctor about any dizziness or muscle weakness that doesn't go away.
Get immediate medical help if you notice any swelling, especially around your head and neck.
Requires routine blood tests to check kidney function.
Don't take it if you're pregnant.

basics.benefits_moa: Micardis is an angiotensin receptor blocker (ARB). By blocking a chemical that usually tightens blood vessels, it makes blood vessels relax. This lowers blood pressure and allows more blood and oxygen to get to your heart and other organs.
basics.bottom_line: Micardis is a good blood pressure-lowering medicine that protects kidney function just like ACE inhibitors, but has fewer side effects.
downsides: Requires a yearly blood test to see how the medicine is affecting your body.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.
Not always covered by insurance, so it can be expensive.

downsides_processed.orig: Requires a yearly blood test to see how the medicine is affecting your body.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.
Not always covered by insurance, so it can be expensive.

upsides: Lowers the risk of heart attack and stroke.
Works similar to ACE inhibitors (like lisinopril), but doesn't have the same side effects like cough and swelling.
Protects kidney function, which is especially useful for people with diabetes or mild-to-moderate kidney disease.
Recommended for people with heart failure since it lowers the risk of death and further damage to your heart.

upsides_processed.orig: Lowers the risk of heart attack and stroke.
Works similar to ACE inhibitors (like lisinopril), but doesn't have the same side effects like cough and swelling.
Protects kidney function, which is especially useful for people with diabetes or mild-to-moderate kidney disease.
Recommended for people with heart failure since it lowers the risk of death and further damage to your heart.

userStories.tip: My blood pressure reduced. I don't feel any other difference after taking this. I did have weird feeling when I tried the generic version. It is the same telmisartan, but it wasn't good. When I checked the packaging, it was Made in China!

drugs.name: Micardis

carousel_items_processed.orig: Can cause dizziness in the first few days.
Get your blood pressure, potassium, and kidney function checked 1 week after starting the medicine, then routinely after.
Tell your doctor about any dizziness or muscle weakness that doesn't go away.
Get immediate medical help if you notice any swelling, especially around your head and neck.
Requires routine blood tests to check kidney function.
Don't take it if you're pregnant.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Micardis can cause birth defects or death to a fetus. If you are pregnant or considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medicines.

description_processed.orig: Micardis can cause birth defects or death to a fetus. If you are pregnant or considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medicines.

risks_warnings.title: Worsening kidney problems
risks_warnings.description: Micardis has a risk of making your kidneys not work as well. It is important to get blood work done to check your kidney function before starting Micardis and at least annually after.

description_processed.orig: Micardis has a risk of making your kidneys not work as well. It is important to get blood work done to check your kidney function before starting Micardis and at least annually after.

risks_warnings.title: Unusual tongue swelling
risks_warnings.description: Angioedema, or swelling in the face, lip, tongue, throat, or other organs, can happen at any time while you're taking Micardis. Talk to a doctor or pharmacist if you have any head or neck swelling or abdominal pain that doesn't go away.

description_processed.orig: Angioedema, or swelling in the face, lip, tongue, throat, or other organs, can happen at any time while you're taking Micardis. Talk to a doctor or pharmacist if you have any head or neck swelling or abdominal pain that doesn't go away.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems due to high potassium
risks_warnings.description: Micardis can increase the amount of potassium in your body. High potassium can cause heart problems. Baseline and routine lab tests are needed to measure your potassium.

description_processed.orig: Micardis can increase the amount of potassium in your body. High potassium can cause heart problems. Baseline and routine lab tests are needed to measure your potassium.

carousel_items: Thins your blood to prevent clots from forming or getting bigger. Doesn't break up existing clots.
The amount you need depends on your diet, other medical problems, and genes.
Take it exactly as instructed.
Can raise your risk of bleeding or bruising.
Requires regular blood tests to get your dose right.
Interacts with a lot of medicines and supplements. Don't start any new meds without talking to your doctor.
Eat foods containing consistent amounts of Vitamin K.
Tell your doctor immediately if you fell or if you have unusual bleeding, bruising, swelling, or changes in vision and coordination.
Get a medical bracelet so that people know you're on a blood thinner during an emergency situation.

basics.benefits_moa: Warfarin is an anticoagulant blood thinner. It lowers chemicals called clotting factors so that it's harder for your body to form blood clots.
basics.bottom_line: Warfarin is an old, cheap, and effective medicine to prevent blood clots, but it requires some monitoring, dose adjustments, and even lifestyle changes.
downsides: Raises your risk of bleeding and bruising.
Requires routine blood testing (called an INR) to see how well the medicine is working for you and to make the dose just right for you.
Many lifestyle factors can affect how well warfarin works, such as diet, alcohol, and activity level, so it's important that you try to stay consistent with your behaviors.
Lots of interactions with other drugs or supplements. Always check with your doctor or pharmacist before starting any new meds.

downsides_processed.orig: Raises your risk of bleeding and bruising.
Requires routine blood testing (called an INR) to see how well the medicine is working for you and to make the dose just right for you.
Many lifestyle factors can affect how well warfarin works, such as diet, alcohol, and activity level, so it's important that you try to stay consistent with your behaviors.
Lots of interactions with other drugs or supplements. Always check with your doctor or pharmacist before starting any new meds.

upsides: Oral blood-thinning medicine that prevents blood clots from forming or getting bigger.

Prevents complications of blood clots that can cause extreme discomfort or death. Examples include stroke (blood clots in the brain), pulmonary embolism (blood clots in the lungs causing trouble breathing), or deep vein thrombosis (blood clots in the legs causing pain and blood vessel damage).
Has an antidote, Vitamin K, in case of a major accidental bleeding.
Warfarin has been around for a long time, so we know a lot about how well it works and what the risks are.
It's dirt cheap.

Has an antidote, Vitamin K, in case of a major accidental bleeding.
Warfarin has been around for a long time, so we know a lot about how well it works and what the risks are.
It's dirt cheap.

risks_warnings.title: Life threatening bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Warfarin is a blood thinner that makes it harder for your blood to clot. Your body may not be able to stop bleeds the way it normally does. Regular monitoring through blood tests, taking the exact amount as instructed, and having a consistent diet can lower your risk of bleeding. Let your doctor know about any persistent or frequent bleeding or bruising, pink urine, red or coffee-ground like stools. If you are bleeding a lot for more than 15 minutes, have a bruise that is getting bigger instead of better, or have fallen and hit your head, go get immediate medical help. In the hospital, doctors can give you a medicine that can reverse the effects of Warfarin.

description_processed.orig: Warfarin is a blood thinner that makes it harder for your blood to clot. Your body may not be able to stop bleeds the way it normally does. Regular monitoring through blood tests, taking the exact amount as instructed, and having a consistent diet can lower your risk of bleeding. Let your doctor know about any persistent or frequent bleeding or bruising, pink urine, red or coffee-ground like stools. If you are bleeding a lot for more than 15 minutes, have a bruise that is getting bigger instead of better, or have fallen and hit your head, go get immediate medical help. In the hospital, doctors can give you a medicine that can reverse the effects of Warfarin.

risks_warnings.title: Dying skin or tissue needing surgery or amputation
risks_warnings.description: Warfarin can cause this rare, but serious, condition where the skin or tissue is dying from poor blood flow. The risk is highest in the first few days to week 8 of starting Warfarin. Let your doctor know about any unusual changes in color of your extremities, breasts, or penis. Your doctor will then find you another blood-thinning medicine to replace Warfarin.

description_processed.orig: Warfarin can cause this rare, but serious, condition where the skin or tissue is dying from poor blood flow. carousel_items: Bisoprolol can make you feel dizzy the first few days you take it, so be careful driving and quickly standing up until you know how your body reacts to it.
Don't stop taking it suddenly without talking to your doctor.
If you have diabetes, Bisoprolol can make it difficult to tell if your blood sugar is low.
Can cause headache, fatigue, and make you more likely to get colds or the flu.

basics.benefits_moa: Bisoprolol is a selective beta blocker that works specifically on the heart. It lowers blood pressure by slowing down the heart and making it work less to pump.
basics.bottom_line: Bisoprolol is usually given to people who have taken  other blood pressure meds unsuccessfully or have recently had significant heart problems.
downsides: This isn't a first choice medication to lower blood pressure.
You can't stop taking it suddenly, or else you're more likely to have a heart attack or other problems with your heart.

downsides_processed.orig: This isn't a first choice medication to lower blood pressure.
You can't stop taking it suddenly, or else you're more likely to have a heart attack or other problems with your heart.

upsides: Good for protecting the heart and lowering blood pressure if you've had a heart attack.
Available in a generic version.
Also comes in combination with other medications to lower blood pressure.

upsides_processed.orig: Good for protecting the heart and lowering blood pressure if you've had a heart attack.
Available in a generic version.
Also comes in combination with other medications to lower blood pressure.

userStories.tip: It says it lasts 24 hours in the system but I still have to take it twice a day to keep effect going.
zaps energy

drugs.name: Bisoprolol

carousel_items_processed.orig: Bisoprolol can make you feel dizzy the first few days you take it, so be careful driving and quickly standing up until you know how your body reacts to it.
Don't stop taking it suddenly without talking to your doctor.
If you have diabetes, Bisoprolol can make it difficult to tell if your blood sugar is low.
Can cause headache, fatigue, and make you more likely to get colds or the flu.

risks_warnings.title: Masked symptoms of low blood sugar
risks_warnings.description: Patients on Bisoprolol who are also diabetic may not recognize symptoms of low blood sugar, except for sweating and dizziness. Talk to your doctor about when to monitor your blood sugar if you are started on Bisoprolol.

description_processed.orig: Patients on Bisoprolol who are also diabetic may not recognize symptoms of low blood sugar, except for sweating and dizziness. Talk to your doctor about when to monitor your blood sugar if you are started on Bisoprolol.

risks_warnings.title: Masked symptoms of overactive thyroid
risks_warnings.description: Patients on Bisoprolol who also have overactive thyroid may not recognize the signs of hyperthyroidism, such as fast heart rate. Don't stop taking Bisoprolol suddenly without talking to your doctor, since this can cause worse thyroid problems.

description_processed.orig: Patients on Bisoprolol who also have overactive thyroid may not recognize the signs of hyperthyroidism, such as fast heart rate. Don't stop taking Bisoprolol suddenly without talking to your doctor, since this can cause worse thyroid problems.

risks_warnings.title: Heart attack
risks_warnings.description: Don't stop taking Bisoprolol suddenly without talking to your doctor if you have coronary artery disease, since chest pain (angina) can increase suddenly or trigger a heart attack.

description_processed.orig: Don't stop taking Bisoprolol suddenly without talking to your doctor if you have coronary artery disease, since chest pain (angina) can increase suddenly or trigger a heart attack.

risks_warnings.title: Increased symptoms of heart failure
risks_warnings.description: Worsening symptoms of heart failure, such as increased swelling in your arms and legs, can occur if your doctor decides to increase your dosage of Bisoprolol. Your doctor can work with you to minimize these effects.

description_processed.orig: Worsening symptoms of heart failure, such as increased swelling in your arms and legs, can occur if your doctor decides to increase your dosage of Bisoprolol. Your doctor can work with you to minimize these effects.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risks during surgery
risks_warnings.description: If you're planning to undergo a major surgery requiring anesthesia, tell your surgeon that you are on Bisoprolol, so they can monitor your heart closely.

description_processed.orig: If you're planning to undergo a major surgery requiring anesthesia, tell your surgeon that you are on Bisoprolol, so they can monitor your heart closely.

basics.benefits_moa: Losartan is an angiotensin receptor blocker (ARB). It blocks a chemical that tightens blood vessels. This makes blood vessels relax, which lowers blood pressure and allows more blood and oxygen to get to your heart and other organs.
basics.bottom_line: Losartan is a good blood pressure-lowering medicine that protects kidney function like an ACE inhibitor, but with fewer side effects.
downsides: Requires a yearly blood test to see how the medicine is affecting your body.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.

Not safe to use if you're pregnant.

upsides: A first-choice blood pressure treatment for many people.
Lowers the risk of heart attack and stroke.
Similar to ACE inhibitors (like Lisinopril), with fewer side effects like cough and swelling.
Protects kidney function, which is especially useful for people with diabetes or mild-to-moderate kidney disease.
Recommended for anyone with heart failure since it lowers the risk of death and further damage to your heart.

carousel_items: Lowers bad cholesterol and triglycerides, and raises good cholesterol.
Most people reach their target cholesterol levels in 4 to 6 weeks.
Works best if you take it once a day after your evening meal.
Avoid grapefruit and grapefruit juice while taking this medicine.
Tell your doctor if you develop sudden muscle pain, fever, or weakness.
Tell your doctor if you notice dark urine or yellowing of the eyes or skin.
Certain medications can interact with this drug. Talk to your doctor or pharmacist.

clock.tip: Take with evening meal and avoid grapefruit juice.
Take with food and avoid grapefruit juice.

basics.benefits_moa: Lovastatin is cholesterol-lowering medicine called a statin. It lowers the amount of cholesterol your body makes, which helps lower "bad" cholesterol (LDL) and raise "good" cholesterol (HDL).
basics.bottom_line: Lovastatin can improve cholesterol, but it's not as strong as other statin medicines. Statin side effects can be difficult to deal with, but the benefits might outweigh the risks.
downsides: Not the best choice for people who have very high cholesterol levels.

Statins can cause digestive problems, blood sugar problems, muscle aches and stiffness, muscle injury, kidney damage, and liver damage. Some people have to stop taking this medicine because of these problems.

You're at higher risk for these side effects if you are female, are 65 years or older, drink alcohol every day, take more than one medicine for cholesterol, or have liver disease, kidney disease, or diabetes.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.

downsides_processed.orig: Not the best choice for people who have very high cholesterol levels.

Statins can cause digestive problems, blood sugar problems, muscle aches and stiffness, muscle injury, kidney damage, and liver damage. Some people have to stop taking this medicine because of these problems.

You're at higher risk for these side effects if you are female, are 65 years or older, drink alcohol every day, take more than one medicine for cholesterol, or have liver disease, kidney disease, or diabetes.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.

upsides: Lowers "bad" cholesterol (LDL) and triglycerides (fats) and raises "good" cholesterol (HDL) in people who have trouble doing this through diet and exercise.
Can lower the risk of heart attack, stroke, and death, particularly if you have diabetes, high blood pressure, obesity, or a history of smoking.

upsides_processed.orig: Lowers "bad" cholesterol (LDL) and triglycerides (fats) and raises "good" cholesterol (HDL) in people who have trouble doing this through diet and exercise.
Can lower the risk of heart attack, stroke, and death, particularly if you have diabetes, high blood pressure, obesity, or a history of smoking.

labeled_indications.indication: Hereditary high cholesterol diseases in adolescents

carousel_items_processed.orig: Lowers bad cholesterol and triglycerides, and raises good cholesterol.
Most people reach their target cholesterol levels in 4 to 6 weeks.
Works best if you take it once a day after your evening meal.
Avoid grapefruit and grapefruit juice while taking this medicine.
Tell your doctor if you develop sudden muscle pain, fever, or weakness.
Tell your doctor if you notice dark urine or yellowing of the eyes or skin.

risks_warnings.title: Muscle pain
risks_warnings.description: There are rare cases of muscle damage leading to kidney failure in people taking Lovastatin. The risk is greater in people with kidney disease or thyroid disease, are older and female and taking certain cholesterol-lowering medication combinations. Tell your doctor if you develop sudden muscle pain, weakness or fever and there is no known cause.

description_processed.orig: There are rare cases of muscle damage leading to kidney failure in people taking Lovastatin. The risk is greater in people with kidney disease or thyroid disease, are older and female and taking certain cholesterol-lowering medication combinations. Tell your doctor if you develop sudden muscle pain, weakness or fever and there is no known cause.

risks_warnings.title: Liver damage
risks_warnings.description: There are reports of liver damage in people who take Lovastatin, especially if they are heavy alcohol drinkers or have a history of liver disease. If you notice dark urine or yellowing of the eyes or skin, tell your doctor. Your doctor may also want to check your liver function periodically.

description_processed.orig: There are reports of liver damage in people who take Lovastatin, especially if they are heavy alcohol drinkers or have a history of liver disease. If you notice dark urine or yellowing of the eyes or skin, tell your doctor. Your doctor may also want to check your liver function periodically.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Don't use while pregnant it can harm your unborn baby. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

description_processed.orig: Don't use while pregnant it can harm your unborn baby. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

risks_warnings.title: Drug interactions
risks_warnings.description: Combining certain medications can increase the risk of muscle pain (myopathy), muscle damage (rhabdomyolysis) and kidney damage. Talk to your doctor or pharmacist when taking any new medications.
risk_factors: Taking with certain drugs that increase the dose of Lovastatin in the body

description_processed.orig: Combining certain medications can increase the risk of muscle pain (myopathy), muscle damage (rhabdomyolysis) and kidney damage. Talk to your doctor or pharmacist when taking any new medications.

risks_warnings.title: Muscle weakness (autoimmune)
risks_warnings.description: There are rare cases of autoimmune-mediated (meaning the body attacks itself) muscle weakness with Lovastatin. Let your doctor know if you notice severe muscle weakness. You may have to stop taking Lovastatin.

description_processed.orig: There are rare cases of autoimmune-mediated (meaning the body attacks itself) muscle weakness with Lovastatin. Let your doctor know if you notice severe muscle weakness. You may have to stop taking Lovastatin.

surveys.question: Besides medications, what else has worked for you?
